website_summaries.verdict: Includes more steel plates and reinforcement for durability than you’d expect to find at this price.
pros: Has up to 4 tons of pulling power at a reasonable cost
Carries a galvanized finish on the 1/4-inch diameter steel cable, so it delivers longevity
Uses a long handle with a non-slip grip so you can apply the maximum amount of force
cons: The safe working load limit is only 2 tons

customer_reviews.title: Avoid cheap junk when dealing with something potentially dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: I used this hand puller to help fell a few trees. The lever to loosen the cable didn't work at all. The hook on the opposite of the cable end is held in by a pin and a cheap c clip that came off while under tension. Coulda killed someone. There was also a cheap metal protective piece that tore off. Unfortunately, I let my temper get the better of me and tossed it instead of returning it. You'd think something that could be so dangerous would be a bit more quality. I only gave it 2 stars because the trees are down and no one died.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: This thing is cheaply made and wont pull anything.
customer_reviews.text: Could tell coming out of the box it was cheaply made in china. Tried to use it by hooking it to the end of my long handle wrench to loosen a nut on my bush hog. I pulled the wench handle with my own strenght (not very much im 65 and have a lot of medical problems). It jamed and would not reverse. Finally got it working again and parts bent on it.
customer_reviews.author: Tonto

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Imitation of Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I used this "come-along" to drag hemlock trees I had cut. The trees were roughly 30 feel long, about 8 inches in diameter, breast height. The "come-along" did the job, so I have it two stars, not one. The safety catch on the main hook fell off. The teeth to engage the gear around the take-up spool, had to be physically held to the gear while pulling the handle, or the spring pulled the teeth away and disengaged. Everything felt cheap. I would not attempt to pull anything close to 2,000 pounds with this device, let alone 4,000. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Foster

customer_reviews.title: Worked, but broke halfway through the job
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving this come-along two stars, it worked, it got the job mostly done, key words ‘mostly done’. One of the two pawl cogs failed, the welds holding the pieces together cracked and the cog shifted resulting in binding. TFG it had two pawl cogs or the whole job could have been dangerous. Lesson from this, the Chinese manufacturer needs to learn how to weld.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Lund

customer_reviews.title: Works but could use improvement
customer_reviews.text: Used the puller the other day to move a safe into my truck the safe weighed between 10-1500 pounds. I have to say that the puller performed admirably however the release catch tends to bind in the gears. I had to stuff a screw driver in while it was under tension...it seemed incredibly shady. Also if the company is located in the Midwest then they should build there stuff in America because as I was cranking I kept seeing the made in China sticker and hearing the cable strain
customer_reviews.author: Elementary Watson

customer_reviews.title: Components cheap, instructions ridiculously inadequate.
customer_reviews.text: This unit has a guide for the cable made of cheap aluminum that bent (could not be straightened) and then broke. Unit is not completely made of sturdy and well-designed parts, causing much difficulty in use. Written instructions were utterly horrible; there's not excuse for those who failed English grammer writing instructions, much less diagrams that don't show all of the parts. Why not photos, too high-tech? BUY ANOTHER COMPANY'S PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Retired Guy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty slimpsy.
customer_reviews.text: Made in China. Don't need to say much more. When first unboxed, I thought something must be wrong because there's no thumb tab on the release spring for the ratchet pawl on the handle. I looked at the instructions and saw, nope, there's nothing wrong, you're just supposed to jam your thumb in there and force the spring back and forth. Pretty slimpsy, as my dad would say. I haven't used it with a load yet, but I anticipate it will be a royal PITA to release the pawl. Plus there's no easy way to convert it to single pull. You're stuck with the pulley on the cable unless you want to deal with snap rings and lock washers.
customer_reviews.author: Chalupa

customer_reviews.title: Very Dangerous Design
customer_reviews.text: Cannot unload the tension if you need to. Very bad design. Have to slide this little spring back and forth to get the teeth to bite and to get the teeth to stand up off sprocket. Avoid this model at all cost. Very dangerous!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Gaskill

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: so far we haven't used this for what we bought it for which was putting up a fence, we have used it for repositioning an old 1 ton truck, also pulling the same truck onto a trailer... pulling a fallen down 15x15 metal wood shed roof back up onto some posts... its worked very easily and very well for those tasks.
customer_reviews.author: teresa robins

customer_reviews.title: Mine was JUNK. Danger Do Not buy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a bad and unsafe design. The ratchet system is operated by sticking your finger in the handle and sliding a small spring from one end of the slot to the other end??? No lever. No button to push no way. The release will not release when tension is on the cable. The cable is not as long as described in the product description. The keepers on the hooks a cheap and flemsy junk. I do not recommend this product and i am sure it will get someone injured or killed.
customer_reviews.author: Virgil Stone

customer_reviews.title: Poorly engineered
customer_reviews.text: The controls on this thing are horrible. To release or engage you have to fight a dang spring in the middle of it. It will work. If you have the time, patience, dexterity and some bravery to get your fingers in there when dealing with heavy loads. Could have been much better designed and I expected better for the ratings and money spent. There is no case that comes with it either. It just had a plastic wrapper on it.
customer_reviews.author: John Knutson

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job, just could be easier
customer_reviews.text: The puller did what I wanted it to but I was a little disappointed in the ease of operation. These type of pullers I had in the past had a lever to switch from "pull in" to "let out", this one does not. You have to manually push the pawl into the gear to operate it. Also, there is no way to use it as a single line pull to speed up light loads without removing "c" clips.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Fair Performance
customer_reviews.text: The ABN Heavy-Duty Hand Puller with Cable Rope – 4-Ton Capacity, Dual (2) Gear works fair for this price range. Had problems with the cable binding up in the spool when under tension. The sprocket plates were pushed out by the cable and jammed up the spool. Had to rebuild the unit and change the 3/8 inch wire cable to synthetic rope to avoid this problem. If your budget can afford it, check out the 3 Ton Ratchet Puller with 35' Of 5/16" Amsteel Blue made by Morepower.
customer_reviews.author: EE

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous. Find another.
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could give it no stars. This is dangerous. You have to manually engage the gear for each pull otherwise the load releases. The safety lock spring is undersize so it doesn’t always catch. I sent this back as soon as I openeded it. No way would I use this.
customer_reviews.author: David G. R.

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 ... both broke.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 for a project pulling up the end of a pier. They worked ok at moderate tension. Once the spool started wrapping tightly, the spool flanges would start cupping and creating mechanical interference with the moving parts to the point that it would seize up. It appears it is due to the sandwiched gears. If they are just used to pull, they might be strong enough, but the can’t hold up to the tension of the wire rope. The second one was having similar issues, until the handle bent like a banana. I went to the local tool rental and finished the job with cast come alongs that were much more durable for $12/half day each.
customer_reviews.author: Demon Bobcat

customer_reviews.title: Very strong Come-a-Long
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one to tension a huge pine tree that was leaning towards my neighbors yard and power lines while I cut the tree down. I'm sure there are a hundred other uses.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: You know you need this!
customer_reviews.text: Less than a week after I got this my father-in-law broke down with his single axle utility trailer.Hooked one hook on my double axle trailer,one on his trailer,and the cable end to my trailer.Pulled the disabled trailer on in no time. This is one of the handiest tools on the ranch.
customer_reviews.author: Sid Pits

customer_reviews.title: It worked well pulling a palm tree stump out of ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked well pulling a palm tree stump out of the ground. I wish the ratchet handle stayed in the locked position and not have to reposition on each crank. This tool saved me several hundred dollars the landscaper wanted to dig up the palm tree.
customer_reviews.author: Greg A

customer_reviews.title: Short cable
customer_reviews.text: Very short. So hopefully you dont have to pull anything too far. Didnt engage easily. I wouldn't buy another
customer_reviews.author: matt e.

customer_reviews.title: Worked well enough
customer_reviews.text: It got the job done but the cable will bind up if you don't watch what you're doing. Satisfied over all.
customer_reviews.author: D Olson

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for stretching about a thousand feet of woven wire fence (longest run is about 200 feet), pulling both from a tractor and from a post. I don't think you can do better for the price. It works very well and seems built to last. Releasing the ratcheting action to allow it to go backwards is a bit awkward in my inexperienced opinion, but it works okay once you understand it.
customer_reviews.author: momof4

customer_reviews.title: has 3 good, wire cable
customer_reviews.text: Con: circlip came off front hook with in 5 minutes out of box. This resulted in the pin falling out. Not a big deal as I live within a mile of a hardware store. World be a big deal if I was in the country. Dogs have to be held down to retrieve cable. Pro: has 3 good, wire cable, handle is adequate size.
customer_reviews.author: tom wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good Tool
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this come along, seems to be built well. We built a house and have logs, rocks, and stumps I have been burning and moving so I wanted this to help with some of the lifting. I got this yesterday and wanted to try it, I must say it worked great pulling a stump the rest of the way out of the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Parrish

customer_reviews.title: Great A++++ wire rope puller for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I may change the pulling cable to a thinner cable so that I can use the puller to reel in longer distances without having to restretch the cable before continued use. Otherwise, a great and very durable tool for the money.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS! Substandard piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: It looked great out of the box and the cable appear does appear to be really heavy duty. Then the first time using this "4 Ton" puller the rinky-dink ratcheting mechanism broke/malfunctioned in both 2 Ton and 4 Ton mode. Used my 20-year old 1 Ton puller to finish the job, no problem. This is a dangerous piece of equipment and someone's going to get hurt using it. Amazon should be pulling this immediately based on liability alone.
customer_reviews.author: G. Mathews

customer_reviews.title: I want a credit to my charge card. I want to send this back immediately!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most dangerous puller I ever bot. The steel cable rubs the cable guide. This will cause fraying and weakening of strands, thus breakage. The engineering on this unit is poor. Amazon is not monitoring quality on their goods.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: in situ worked as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Winched up a felled tree, works great but would've preferred a longer chain.
customer_reviews.author: Tucson Rocks

customer_reviews.title: Lift a tree with no problem
customer_reviews.text: Helped to right the palm trees that were blown over by the hurricane. Instructions could have been better.
customer_reviews.author: SteveFlorida

customer_reviews.title: HD come along
customer_reviews.text: Good heavy duty quality, very strong and easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Vincent H.

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: I like the puller, it only has one release, 2 on most so you can't pull the hook out with both taken. It's made well, strong and a good value. One otwo were cheaper, but I made the right decision.
customer_reviews.author: Animal

customer_reviews.title: Puller
customer_reviews.text: Great Puller. I have a 20' flat bed. Need help pulling what ever. It will come in handy around our 5 acre ranch.
customer_reviews.author: David Wells

customer_reviews.title: Zipline bliss!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after struggling several weekends to get a zipline installed and pulled tight enough. This unit was PERFECT and handled the job with ease.
customer_reviews.author: C. Crane

customer_reviews.title: well built
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for my garage, I doubt i will ever over load it as it seems very well made and at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Dino

customer_reviews.title: it has too jaws to pull and not just 1 like the cheaper ones and it has the detachable hook ...
customer_reviews.text: works well , it has too jaws to pull and not just 1 like the cheaper ones and it has the detachable hook to to make it longer.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Matousek

customer_reviews.title: They worked great. We moved a huge heavy 32 year old ...
customer_reviews.text: They worked great. We moved a huge heavy 32 year old building with the come alongs and straps. Great product and delivery was fast fast. Mike
customer_reviews.author: Mike Delware

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and worked for my purpose. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Heavy Duty Come Along
customer_reviews.text: I needed a come along to pull out a stump on my property. This unit did a great job and worked on the first try. It was a difficult job made easy.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I have used this come a long a few times. It works well. A little cheaply made though
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Peck

customer_reviews.title: I recently purchased this come along and am disappointed. The cable isn't tracking correctly and the guide ...
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this come along and am disappointed. The cable isn't tracking correctly and the guide is flimsy and has bent very easily. Also, with the first use, the teeth that engage the spool became misaligned as soon as moderate pressure was applied and the entire frame of the unit began to bind. For an American made product rated for 4 tons, this was not a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: James P. McGannon

customer_reviews.title: ease of use
customer_reviews.text: it works fine but it is a little bulky and the release lever is too short making it a little hard when releasing.
customer_reviews.author: Ike

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty, and everyone traveling offroad should have one. Ha Dy for many applications.
customer_reviews.author: Ruston

customer_reviews.title: Did the job at a fair price
customer_reviews.text: We used this tool to tension strand wire between utility poles. It is maybe nor the ideal too for that job but it did what we wanted at a good price and the delivery was quick.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Turnbull

customer_reviews.title: 4ft comalong
customer_reviews.text: Looks of moderate craftsmanship but is only 4ft from hook to hook
customer_reviews.author: Maria Whaley

customer_reviews.title: quality materials
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to use the puller however it appears to be very nice quality and I'm not concerned about it working properly
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: quality built tool
customer_reviews.text: like the quality and make of the tool, should last a lifetime
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Trotter

customer_reviews.title: Well built for heavy load
customer_reviews.text: Appreciate this well build tool. Only one minor thing. Would have liked the length of the cable to be longer.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Come a long
customer_reviews.text: Used to lift trailer gate, pull out lawn mower. Has more range than my last come a long.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Stewart

customer_reviews.title: so good. I used it to help take down a ...
customer_reviews.text: So far....so good. I used it to help take down a 80 foot oak!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn F.

customer_reviews.title: Worked flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked great! And for the price, I cant complain. It did it’s job working on my car just as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Carson Dilling

customer_reviews.title: Great Winch....directions how to release tension is confusing.
customer_reviews.text: Used it to winch a HEAVY dogwood tree that was leaning from a storm and the weight of heavy limbs. I pulled the tree upright-strait and used another winch to stretch some wire rope to anchor it against another tree. It did the job. I would have given it 5 stars if the directions for releasing the tension was a lot more clearer. The diagram was not clear at all. I never found out how to release the tension by the directions and the diagram. I had to cut the other side of the wire rope from the opposite side to get the winch back. Does anyone know where I can get better directions how to release?
customer_reviews.author: Humbleb

customer_reviews.title: Best come along I've owned.
customer_reviews.text: Impressive, has worked on all projects. The long handle gives all the leverage needed w/o a cheater pipe. Delivered very fast. Would recommend to a friend!
customer_reviews.author: Terry Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good product, not junk like some.
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well. Is a lot more sturdy than some and way nicer than the 2 ton ones. Don't waste your time with the lighter ones.
customer_reviews.author: Rory Loomis

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Broken in 5 minutes! Don't buy this if you want a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I plan to keep it. It is considerably heavier ...
customer_reviews.text: I plan to keep it. It is considerably heavier than a two ton puller that I have had in the past. -- Robert Carpenter
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable!!
customer_reviews.text: Very Sturdy item. I have it packed in my truck set up and ready to go. When I received the product I practiced using it in the yard which was very useful. I haven't had to use it for real as of yet however I'm confident it will work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was for my husband and he was very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still in the box. Needed it to pull a ...
customer_reviews.text: Still in the box. Needed it to pull a tree out the way. Made in China so I hope it works when I finally get around to it, thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Peg Leg Pirate

customer_reviews.title: Strong, good quality, functions well, and delivered on-time and as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Used immediately to cut down/drop 10+ pine trees, 60' to 80' tall trees. Works very well, excellent strength and weight capacity. An additional 2 feet of pull distance would function better, yet this did the job very well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve L.

customer_reviews.title: Come on its a come-a-long LoL...
customer_reviews.text: It's a come-a-long. As long as the cable or locks don't break it's a good buy LoL...
customer_reviews.author: Yogi Bellcourt

product_meta.title: ABN Heavy-Duty Hand Puller with Cable Rope – 4 Ton Capacity, Dual (2) Gear, 3 Hooks – Come Along Cable Puller Tool
feature_bullets: PULL HEAVY LOADS: The ABN Heavy-Duty Hand Puller with Cable Rope – 4 Ton Capacity, Dual (2) Gear, 3 Hooks – Come Along Cable Puller Tool is a dual gear hand puller with a 1/4-inch (6.4mm) cable diameter and 3-plate ratchet and pawl that is ideal for any machine shop, boating, camping, landscaping, and farming

BUILT TO LAST: 8,000-pound (3,629kg) maximum rated capacity; 4,000-pound (1,814kg) safe working load limit (WLL); Constructed from 1/4-inch (6.4mm) braided steel cable with galvanized finish; Heavy-duty ratchet and pawl made from 3 separate plates of steel for extra strength and longevity

3 HOOKS FOR VARIOUS APPLICATIONS: 1/4-inch (6.4mm) hooks with 12.6-foot (3.8m) pull length can be used to move heavy equipment, tighten fencing, landscaping such as removing tree stumps or debris and assist in loading a boat onto a trailer.
GRIP COMFORTABLY: 21-inch (53cm) high-leverage steel ratchet handle with nonslip cushioned rubber grip that offers safe and comfortable operation for less user fatigue and more productivity
SAFETY FIRST: The drop-forged hooks include spring safety latches to keep you away from accidents and injuries and keep your application untouched and damage-free

specifications.Warranty Description: This product has a manufacturer warranty against defects in materials and workmanship for a period of ONE
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars220 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
